projects.emafyLong:
This is a custom wrapper for Spotify, which can be used to visualize and play songs, artists, albums and playlists.

The project was created using primarily React and Styled Components, and the main goal was to learn these frameworks, improve my skills with them, and study front-end concepts. Furthermore, it was used to experiment with multiple React libraries, such as infinite scroll, jest, and font awesome. It was also used to perform a migration from CRA setup to Parcel.

This project was first created with the help of Afonso Ferrer, a coworker of mine, and later on maintained by me. The website is deployed at Github Pages.
projects.expensableLong:
This is an online tool created to manage expenses and savings. The user can log all of their daily expenses, assign them to custom categories and view a monthly or periodic dashboard in order to keep track of financial goals.

The project was designed using Remix, Prisma, MongoDB and TailwindCSS. The main goals here were to A) replace a set of spreadsheets I was using to keep track of my expenses and B) learn Remix and acquire a little bit of experience with MongoDB.

Further instructions on how to use the application can be found in the project ReadMe on its repository in Github.

An initial version of the app is available at Vercel

projects.portfolioLong:
So far I had three versions of my portfolio, with this being the third one. It was developed using AstroJS and Tailwind, following a view transitions tutorial by Jack Herrington (available on Youtube).

The first version was a very bland one developed with pure React, React Router and class components, while the second one was created with NextJS and Tailwind. All versions used a design developed by myself.

The main reason for developing a third version in favor of the second one is the effectiveness of AstroJS for this type of project (and to also try a few more transitions).
